alert.note: Alert for Surry; Wilkes; Yadkin (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 13 at 2:45PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHWESTERN SURRY...EAST CENTRAL WILKES...AND NORTHWESTERN YADKIN COUNTIES THROUGH 330 PM EDT... At 245 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Benham, or near Elkin, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Elkin... Fairview... Jonesville... Dobson... Boonville... Ronda... and Mountain Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
